topic.title: anybody who has win10 leaked 1.2GB source code
topic.body: can you provide a download link?thanks a lot

1509072726_16GWX71BEAotmJWQSdGQqPUiiW3Uj.body:
> [jpf3zww4gaui5urh](#comment_1_16Ld5cSuDN9k4XhxfSBukLXmoBGhgREmex): You mean, the thing that were shared on some FTP few months ago? It was not complete source code, just what Microsoft had already shared to partners under their shared source program.

yes,i just want that,do you have it?

> [mari0](#comment_13_1BMjn5jgrLrGbQTbnZDLFKUuxP2ZBr4ufC): Who would even need this crap?The only thing people would be good off if they had it would be documentation for undocumented public functions in Microsoft's libraries and good test cases.Also, people donating to Wine project.If we ever want to ditch Windows we gotta have Wine working even better, the only way non-coders can help is by donating or buying Crossover Linux. Programmers can help by contributing code to the project or making extensionsAnd... yeah, Wine has tools which allow to make extensions for it, but loading these extensions is a bit difficult without changing either the windows program or environment variables. [...]

for research some windows x64 structs,did you heard about there has a  career called Reverse Engineer
